pageContext.claim: “Hard to believe I won and am winning. Approval Rating 52%, 93% with Republicans.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cited a month-old daily tracking poll (Feb. 11) by Rasmussen, which consistently has a Republican-leaning bias; it fell to 50 percent the next day. As of the date of this tweet, Rasmussen's poll showed Trump with 48 percent approval. The polling gurus at FiveThirtyEight say that an adjusted rating would have shown Trump at 43 percent in the poll. On the day of the tweet, Trump had an average approval of 41.4 percent in 538's blended poll rating, along with 53.7 percent disapproval.
